title: No.22.-The Wesleyan holiness Church (Incorporating and Vesting Act,2002.
title_en: No.22.-The Wesleyan holiness Church (Incorporating and Vesting Act,2002.
short_name: No.22.-The Wesleyan holiness Church (Incorporating and Vesting Act,2002.

provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. This Act may be cited as the Wesleyan Holiness Church Short title.
  (Incorporation and Vesting) Act, 2002.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. In this Act unless the context otherwise requires-               Interpretation.
        "the Church" means collectively the several churches and
             persons for the time being associated in Jamaica under
             the names of the Eastern, Western and Northern Districts
             of The Wesleyan Holiness Church; and
        "the Corporation" means the Body incorporated by this Act.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3.-(1) The Wesleyan Holiness Church shall consist of a body Incorporation.
   of nine persons to be known as the Wesleyan Holiness Church
   Committee; and such Committee is hereby declared constituted
   and appointed a corporation or body corporate to have continuance

                     forever and perpetual succession by the name of "The Wesleyan
                     Holiness Church" and possessed of a corporate seal and by th
                     name may sue and be sued in all Courts of this Island.       at
                            (2) Each District of the Church shall be entitled to appoint
                     two persons from amongst the members of their respective Districts
                     to the Committee and the remammg three persons shall be Assistant
                     Superintendent for the time being of each District; and such persons
                     shall officially represent their respective Districts.
                           (3) The members of the Committee shall appoint from
                     amongst themselves a chairman, three District Superintendents (one
                     for each District of the Church), a secretary and a treasurer.
                           (4) Until the first appointments are made to the posts referred
                     to in subsection (3), the following persons shall hold the office

 until the recording or lodging of a certificate of the appointment of

     (5) Unless its by-laws shall otherwise provide, no deed or
document purported to be executed by the Corporation shall be of
any force or validity unless it be sealed with the seal of the
Corporation and signed by no less than three members of the Board
among whom shall be the Chairman, Secretary and a Member.
        ( 6) In the case of any other religious entity or congregation
 desiring to unite with the Corporation and to adopt its tenets,
 doctrines, beliefs and forms of worship and to submit to its
 jurisdiction, the Corporation may accept the transfer of the property
 of such other religious entity or congregation to be held subject to
 the trusts affecting the property vested in the Corporation, and such
  transfer shall be made by the trustee of such property under the
  resolution of such other religious entity or congregation directing
  such transfer duly passed at a meeting of such other religious entity
  or congregation by the like majorities and in like manner as would
   authorize a sale of the same lands, or otherwise duly passed in
   accordance with the rules or practices of such other religious entity
  or congregation.

provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7. The provisions of The Pilgrim Holiness Church Incorporation Application of
Act, 1944 and the Missionary Bands of the World (Incorporation Law.
and Vesting) Law, 1949 shall not apply to or in any way affect the
operation of the Corporation hereby created.

provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8. Nothing in this Act shall prejudice or affect the rights of Her saving or
Majesty the Queen, Her Heirs and Successors, the Government of Prerogative.
Jamaica or of any body, politic or corporate or of any other persons
except such as are mentioned in this Act and those claiming by,
from, through or under them.

provisions.title: Section 9
provisions.content:
9. If upon the dissolution of the Church there remains after the Procedure
satisfaction of all its debts and liabilities any property whatsoever, "on
                           ·         · ·                               dissolution of
the same shall not be paid to or distributed among the members of Corporation.
the Church but shall be given or transferred to some other religious
denomination or denominations having disciplines similar to the
disciplines of the Church and shall prohibit the distribution of its
or their income and property among its or their members to an
extent at least as great as is imposed on the Church such religious
denomination or denominations to be determined by the members
of the Church at or before the time of dissolution or in default
thereof by such Judge of the Supreme Court as may have or acquire
jurisdiction in the matter and if and so far as effect cannot be given
 to this provision then to a charitable object.
